name: Waterloo Wellington Flight Centre - WWFC
about: Waterloo Wellington Flight Centre (WWFC), founded in 1932, is a renowned flight school deeply rooted in the Waterloo region. Located at the Region of Waterloo International Airport, WWFC offers exceptional training programs for both professional and private pilots. With a fleet of 31 modern training aircraft and state-of-the-art facilities, WWFC provides a student-centric learning environment. Partnered with the University of Waterloo and Conestoga College, WWFC offers unique programs such as Geography and Aviation, and Science and Aviation, combining flight training with a strong academic foundation. The centre also offers modular training, drone pilot training, and maintains a 8,000 square foot hangar for aircraft maintenance. As a not-for-profit organization, WWFC is committed to providing high-quality resources and a safe learning environment, making it one of the top flight schools in Canada. WWFC is dedicated to helping aspiring pilots achieve their aviation goals.
services:

Commercial Pilot License
Flight Instructor (CFI / FI)
